REUTERS/KCNA NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR SEOUL (Reuters) - Thousands gathered in Pyongyang for the opening of the “Arirang” mass games, an annual spectacle celebrating North Korea’s leaders and history, even as their nation suffers from chronic food shortages and asks other nations for aid. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Nearly two million died from hunger in the 1990s, and shortages loom again following a severe winter and flooding this year. A U.N. report said in March that more than 6 million people are in urgent need of outside assistance. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But none of this showed on Monday night’s opening performance, which took place on the 63rd anniversary of North Korea’s founding with hundreds of thousands of people taking part in carefully choreographed dances and gymnastics displays, official news agency KCNA said.
